In the [[Northern Hemisphere]], the [[Summer solstice]] occurs between 20 or 22 June. In the [[Southern Hemisphere]], the [[Winter solstice]] occurs on this date. 

==Events==
* [[451]] &ndash; [[Battle of Chalons]]: [[Flavius Aetius]]' battles [[Attila the Hun]]. After the battle, which was inconclusive, Attila retreats, causing the Romans to interpret it as a victory.
*[[1214]] &ndash; The [[University of Oxford]] receives its [[Royal charter#United Kingdom|Royal charter]].
*[[1631]] &ndash; The [[sack of Baltimore]]: the [[Ireland|Irish]] village of [[Baltimore, County Cork|Baltimore]] is attacked by [[Algeria]]n [[piracy|pirates]].
*[[1652]] &ndash; [[Tarhoncu Ahmet Paşa]] is appointed [[grand vezir]] of the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1685]] &ndash; [[Monmouth Rebellion]]: [[James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth]] declares himself [[King of England]] at [[Bridgwater]].
*[[1756]] &ndash; A [[British Empire|British]] [[garrison]] is imprisoned in the [[Black Hole of Calcutta]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] adopts the [[Great Seal of the United States]].
*[[1787]] &ndash; [[Oliver Ellsworth]] moves at the [[Federal Convention]] to call the government the [[United States]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[Deputy (legislator)|Deputies]] of the [[History of France|French]] [[Estates-General of 1789|Third Estate]] take the [[Tennis Court Oath]].
*[[1819]] &ndash; The U.S. vessel {{SS|Savannah}} arrives at [[Liverpool]], [[United Kingdom]]. It is the first steam-propelled vessel to cross the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]], although most of the journey is made under sail.
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Victoria of the United Kingdom|Queen Victoria]] succeeds to the [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|British throne]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; [[Samuel Morse]] receives the patent for the [[telegraph]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Barbu Catargiu]], the [[Prime Minister of Romania]], is assassinated.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[West Virginia]] is admitted as the 35th [[U.S. state]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[Alexander Graham Bell]] installs the world's first commercial [[telephone]] service in [[Hamilton, Ontario]], [[Canada]].
*[[1887]] &ndash; [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus|Victoria Terminus]], the busiest railway station in India, opens in [[Mumbai|Bombay]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[Lizzie Borden]] is acquitted of the murders of her father and stepmother.
*[[1895]] &ndash; The [[Kiel Canal]], crossing the base of the [[Jutland]] peninsula and the busiest artificial waterway in the world, is officially opened.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Boxer Rebellion]]: The [[Imperial Chinese Army]] begins a [[Siege of the International Legations|55-day siege]] of the [[Beijing Legation Quarter|Legation Quarter]] in [[Beijing]], [[China]].
*  1900   &ndash; Baron [[Eduard Toll]], leader of the [[Russian polar expedition of 1900–02|Russian Polar Expedition of 1900]], departs [[Saint Petersburg]] in Russia on the explorer ship ''[[Zarya (polar ship)|Zarya]]'', never to return.
*[[1921]] &ndash; Workers of [[Buckingham and Carnatic Mills]] in the city of [[Chennai]], [[India]], begin a [[1921 Buckingham and Carnatic Mills Strike|four-month strike]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; World War II: Italy begins an [[Italian invasion of France|unsuccessful invasion]] of France.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: [[Kazimierz Piechowski]] and three others, dressed as members of the [[SS-Totenkopfverbände]], steal an SS staff car and escape from the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; The [[Detroit Race Riot (1943)|Detroit Race Riot]] breaks out and continues for three more days.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of the Philippine Sea]] concludes with a decisive [[United States Navy|U.S. naval]] victory. The lopsided naval air battle is also known as the "Great Marianas Turkey Shoot".
*  1944   &ndash; [[Continuation war]]: the [[Soviet Union]] demands an unconditional surrender from [[Finland]] during the beginning of partially successful [[Vyborg&ndash;Petrozavodsk Offensive]]. The Finnish government refuses.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[United States Secretary of State]] approves the transfer of [[Wernher von Braun]] and his team of Nazi rocket scientists to America.
*[[1948]] &ndash; ''[[Toast of the Town]]'', later ''[[The Ed Sullivan Show]]'', makes its television debut.
*[[1956]] &ndash; A [[Venezuela]]n [[Lockheed Constellation|Super-Constellation]] [[Linea Aeropostal Venezolana Flight 253 (June 1956)|crashes]] in the Atlantic Ocean off [[Asbury Park, New Jersey]], killing 74 people.<!--Resulted in plane design regulations-->
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[1959 Escuminac Hurricane|A rare June hurricane]] strikes Canada's Gulf of St. Lawrence killing 35.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The [[Mali Federation]] gains independence from France (it later splits into [[Mali]] and [[Senegal]]).
*[[1963]] &ndash; The so-called "[[Moscow-Washington hotline|red telephone]]" link is established between the Soviet Union and the United States following the [[Cuban Missile Crisis]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Watergate scandal]]: An 18½-minute gap appears in the [[Watergate tapes|tape recording]] of the conversations between U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] and his advisers regarding the recent arrests of his operatives while [[Watergate burglaries|breaking into]] the [[Watergate complex]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[1973 Ezeiza massacre|Ezeiza massacre]] in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]]. [[Sniper]]s fire upon left-wing [[Peronism|Peronists]]. At least 13 are killed and more than 300 are injured.
*[[1979]] &ndash; ABC News correspondent [[Bill Stewart (journalist)|Bill Stewart]] is shot dead by a [[Nicaragua]]n soldier under the regime of [[Anastasio Somoza Debayle]]. The murder is caught on tape and sparks an international outcry against the regime.
*[[1982]] &ndash; The Argentine base [[Corbeta Uruguay]] on [[Southern Thule]] surrenders to Royal Marine commandos in the final action of the [[Falklands War]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Asteroid]] [[5261 Eureka|Eureka]] is discovered.
*[[1991]] &ndash; The German [[Bundestag]] votes to move the [[capital (political)|capital]] from [[Bonn]] back to [[Berlin]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Andrea Yates]], in an attempt to save her young children from [[Satan]], drowns all five of them in a bathtub in [[Houston, Texas]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Wikimedia Foundation]] is founded in [[St. Petersburg, Florida]].
